body.p:
Cattlettsburg Ky
Nov 10th 1864
Thomas E Bramlett Esqr
Govenor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

You will please pardon me for again invoking your clemency in behalf of another one of our fellow citizens but the frequent importunity of some of the most respected citizens of Lawrence county and my own sense of justice impells me to ask in ernest expression of the pardon of Gabriel Endicott who is now a prisoner in the Penitentiary of this State upon -- sentence of Man Slaughter -- the petition which will accompany this letter is signed by the very best citizens of the county in which Endicott was
convicted, and by some who wer most ernest in his prosecution I myself was employed to prosecute him, His good conduct since he has been in the penitentiary has elicited the favourable consideration of the keeper our Common friend Harry Todd and I am sure no one will be more gratified at his pardon than he, Trusting you may find it consistent with your sense of duty to pardon Endicott

I am as ever your friend
and obt servt
Laban T Moore
